info.title: Front Financial Integration Catalog API
info.description: Front Integration Catalog allows users of client applications to connect accounts of financial institutions. Front Integration Catalog handles credential validation, multi-factor authentication, and error handling for each institution. After the account is connected, Front Integration Catalog allows client applications to get account information, such as holdings, transactions, balances.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret

get.description: Get personalized catalog link for client

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description:
A unique Id representing the end user. Typically this will be a user Id from the
            client application. Personally identifiable information, such as an email address or phone number,
            should not be used.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Type of broker to redirect to. Will redirect to catalog if not provided.

parameters.name: callbackUrl
parameters.description:
Callback link - url to redirect user after authentication in brokerage account.
If not provided default client's url will be used.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Client secret, should be stored safely and never shared

400.description:
BadRequest can happen in following cases:
<list type="number"><item><description>userId parameter not specified</description></item><item><description>Callback url parameter is invalid</description></item><item><description>Client does not have callback url specified</description></item></list>

401.description: Unauthorized: Client Id or Client Secret are not correct or missing.

post.description:
Refresh auth token of the connected institution.
Some institutions do not require tokens to be refreshed.
            
The following institutions require custom flows:
            
WeBull: AuthToken should be provided along with the RefreshToken
            
TdAmeritrade: refresh token should also be refreshed.
CreateNewRefreshToken parameter should be set to true in order
to refresh the refresh token for TdAmeritrade.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Client secret, should be stored safely and never shared

example.displayMessage: Could not refresh the authentication token. The provided data is not correct

get.summary: Retrieve news related to the symbol in the request
get.description: Retrieve news related to the symbol in the request.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: Lower timestamp limit of the news. If not speciefied news will be returned from the last 7 days.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: Upper timestamp limit of the news. If not speciefied news will be returned up to the current time.

parameters.name: Symbol
parameters.description: Specifies which symbol's news should be returned.

parameters.name: Count
parameters.description: The number of news to return. If not specified the maximum 25 value will be used.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: The offset which is used for paginatin the result set.

parameters.name: Order
parameters.description: Specifies the sorting criteria of the news. By default the most relevant news will be returned first.

parameters.name: SortDirection
parameters.description: Specifies the soring direction of the result set.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Client secret, should be stored safely and never shared

200.description: The list of news related to the symbol.

news.title: Freshpet, Inc. (NASDAQ:FRPT) Shares Sold by Asset Management One Co. Ltd. - Armenian Reporter
news.content: Freshpet, Inc. (NASDAQ:FRPT) Shares Sold by Asset Management One Co. Ltd. - Armenian Reporter

post.summary: Get supported order features for institution
post.description:
Get supported features for trading for a particular financial institution. Different institutions support different
features (e.g. different `OrderType` or different sets of `TimeInForce` values), so this endpoint is used to
describe such features for provided financial institution.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Client secret, should be stored safely and never shared

401.description: Unauthorized: Client Id or Client Secret are not correct or provided integration token is not correct.

post.description:
Validates the order information (such as necessary balance availability), and returns additional information,
such as expected order fee.
Does not execute the order.

post.description:
Validates the order information and then calls institution's API to execute an order.
It's recommended to call this endpoint after calling the `preview` endpoint to make sure that the
order execution request is correct.

`SymbolPair` is required to be provided for `Binance`, `BinanceInternational`, `Okx` and `BitFlyer` institutions.
This value

post.description:
Returns information on trading allowance for a provided symbol.
For example - some institutions allow fractional trading for some symbols, but do not allow it
for others. So before placing an order the API client can check if the required symbol can be traded fractionally
with the provided institution.

post.description:
Get details of the asset for deposit or withdrawal. For example, several exchanges support same tokens over multiple
blockchains, and thus require the name of chain to be supplied for transfers. This endpoint allows getting such details.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: X-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Client secret, should be stored safely and never shared

200.description: Address successfully obtained or generation initiated.

404.description: Asset details for provided symbol are not found.

401.description: Unauthorized: Client Id or Client Secret are not correct or missing.

message.description: A message generated by the API

displayMessage.description: User-friendly display message that can be presented to the end user

name.description: Name of the field, as expected from the API

fields.description: Set of fields that are expected to be provided based on the status of the AuthResponse

cash.description: Withdrawable cash amount on the account.

buyingPower.description: Buying power indicating the maximum amount the user can spend to buy assets. E.g. available margin.

cryptocurrencyBuyingPower.description: Buying power available for placing cryptocurrency orders.

challengeAnswer.description: Used to provide answers to security questions

challengeId.description: Id of the challenge, relevant when the status is `ChallengeIssued`

transactionId.description: Transaction Id by the financial institution

statusDetails.description: Details of the current status of the transfer, as provided by the financial institution

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

symbol.description: Symbol to trade. For example, `AAPL` or `ETH`

paymentSymbol.description: Symbol to use for payment, defaults to `USD`.

price.description: Price of the unit, used for `Limit` and `StopLoss` orders.

isCryptocurrency.description: Some Stock and Crypto symbols can intersect, so the type of the asset needs to be specified explicitly.

paymentIsCryptocurrency.description: Indicates whether the `PaymentSymbol` is fiat or cryptocurrency

amountIsFiat.description:
This value indicates if the order should be executed in fiat amount (e.g. purchase ETH for $10). This can be
performed only if the current institution supports such orders (`SupportsPlacingSellOrdersInFiatAmount` and
`SupportsPlacingBuyOrdersInFiatAmount` fields in `get supported order features for institution`) and `AmountInFiat`
value is passed.

amountInFiat.description:
Specifies the target amount in fiat currency. For example setting this to `10` when the `AmountIsFiat` = `true`
and `PaymentSymbol` = `USD` will instruct the API to place an order to buy/sell the asset worth $10.

extendedHours.description: Specifies if the extended trading hours should be used.

orderId.description: Id of the order, as returned from the financial institution. Can be used to get the status of the order.

fee.description: Optional Fee taken by the financial institution.

statusDetails.description: Text details of the order, if additionally returned from the financial institution.

timeInForce.description: Value that indicates how long the order will remain active before it is executed or expires.

symbolPair.description: Optional pair of symbols, as returned from the financial institution. Can be required to obtain the status of the order by some institutions.

parentOrderId.description: Id of the parent order, applicable to some institutions if the order was executed in several trades.

trades.description: List of trades, provided only if the order was executed in several trades.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error if the order wasn't placed.

displayMessage.description: A user-friendly display message that can be presented to the end user.

id.description: Identifier of the transfer, if provided by the financial institution

statusDetails.description: Details of the current status of the transfer, as provided by the financial institution

fromAddress.description: Address where the transaction was sent from

targetAddress.description: Address where the transaction was sent to

chain.description: Crypto Chain the transaction belongs to

amount.description: Full amount affected the balance, typically transaction amount plus fee

createdTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating when the transaction was created

updatedTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating when the transaction was last updated

transferFee.description: Fee taken by the financial institution

confirmations.description: Number of confirmations on the blockchain

blockchainMethodName.description: Name of the executed blockchain function based on decoded input data

blockchainMethod.description: Executed blockchain function based on decoded input data. Not guaranteed to be identified

numberOfSharesInContract.description: Number of shares covered by option

id.description: Transaction id, as provided by the institution

paymentSymbol.description:
Fiat or cryptocurrency symbol used for payment. For transactions with types `ConversionFrom` or `ConversionTo`
this field specifies the target symbol. For example, for `ETH` to `BTC` conversion, the transaction type is `ConversionTo`, the `Symbol` field is `ETH` and the `PaymentSymbol` is `BTC`

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment was performed with fiat or crypto currency

fee.description: Order Fee, taken by the financial institution

createdTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating when the order was placed or the transaction was created

updatedTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating when the transaction was last updated (e.g. executed)

statusDetails.description: Status text, as provided by the institution

timeInForce.description: Time in force of the order: a value indicating how long the order remains active before it is executed or expires

parentOrderId.description: Id of the parent order, applicable to some institutions

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

cursor.description:
The cursor to retrieve the next page of transactions.
Providing it will cause the response to only return changes after this update.
If this field is not provided, the history of transactions will be returned starting with the first-added transaction.

count.description:
Number of records to include in the response.
Default: `100`
Maximum: `250`

statuses.description: Return orders of this statuses only. If this field is not provided, orders with all available statuses will be returned.

cursor.description: The cursor to retrieve the next page of transactions.

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

isCryptocurrency.description: Some Stock and Crypto symbols can intersect, so we need to explicitly specify what type of asset is requested to be bought.

symbolPair.description: Symbol pair of the order (requested by some brokers).

fractionalTradingAllowance.description: Specifies if the fractional trading is allowed for the provided symbol

precisionScale.description: Maximum number of decimal digits accepted by the symbol

status.description: Status of the request to the institution's API

displayMessage.description: User-friendly error message, optimized to be shown to the end user

equityPositions.description: Equity holdings, such as stocks and ETFs

notSupportedEquityPositions.description: The equity positions Front could not recognize

notSupportedCryptocurrencyPositions.description: The cryptocurrency positions Front could not recognize

accountId.description: External institution's account id (returned by the institution)

institutionName.description: Friendly name of the connected institution

accountName.description: Name of the account as returned from the institution

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

symbol.description: Symbol to trade. For example, `AAPL` or `ETH`

paymentSymbol.description: Symbol to use for payment, defaults to `USD`.

price.description: Price of the unit, used for `Limit` and `StopLoss` orders.

isCryptocurrency.description: Some Stock and Crypto symbols can intersect, so the type of the asset needs to be specified explicitly.

paymentIsCryptocurrency.description: Indicates whether the `PaymentSymbol` is fiat or cryptocurrency

amountIsFiat.description:
This value indicates if the order should be executed in fiat amount (e.g. purchase ETH for $10). This can be
performed only if the current institution supports such orders (`SupportsPlacingSellOrdersInFiatAmount` and
`SupportsPlacingBuyOrdersInFiatAmount` fields in `get supported order features for institution`) and `AmountInFiat`
value is passed.

amountInFiat.description:
Specifies the target amount in fiat currency. For example setting this to `10` when the `AmountIsFiat` = `true`
and `PaymentSymbol` = `USD` will instruct the API to place an order to buy/sell the asset worth $10.

extendedHours.description: Specifies if the extended trading hours should be used.

cryptocurrencyOrders.description: Model, describing the ability to place cryptocurrency orders.

stockOrders.description: Model, describing the ability to place equity orders.

supportsOrderPreview.description:
Indicates if the preview of orders (`preview order execution` endpoint) is provided by the institution.
This allows to validate the order using the API of the institution. If the order preview is not supported,
Front API validates the order without calling the institution's API.

supportsOrderCancellation.description: Indicates if it is possible to cancel the placed order, while it's in the `InProgress` status.

isIntegrationUp.description: Indicates if the integration is available.

isTradingSupported.description: Indicates if trading is generally supported at this time.

fiatBalances.description: List of fiat balances of the account.

isUp.description: Is the communication with the integration up

downTimeStart.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating when the outage occurred

downTimeEnd.description: Unix timestamp in seconds indicating expected end of the outage

supportedProducts.description: Get products supported by the financial institution

direction.description: Side of the option, buy or sell

numberOfSharesInContract.description: Number of shares of the underlying stock

optionType.description: Type of the option, put or call

expirationDate.description: The last day that the option contract is valid

strikePrice.description: The price at which a put or call option can be exercised

financialScore.description:
Front analyzes available financial data to reach a determination on risk associated with an asset based on its underlying financial conditions.
The Financials Score is a strong metric for investors who seek stocks that are underperforming and ripe for growth.

performanceScore.description:
Front's proprietary algorithm performs advanced statistical analysis.
We use tools popular among hedge funds to assess historical performance based on different categories and volatility of assets over a short period of time.

newsScore.description:
Front Market Monitor autonomously crawls tens of thousands of websites
at a time and assigns each stock a score based on the news stories

esgScore.description:
Environmental, Social, Governance
Parameters are a set of standards used to evaluate investments.
Environmental criteria consider how a company performs as a proponent of nature.
Social criteria examine how it manages relationships with employees, suppliers, customers,
and the communities where it operates. Governance deals with a companys leadership, audits, and shareholder rights.

portfolioCostBasis.description: Amount of money spent to buy all positions of the portfolio.

actualPortfolioPerformance.description: Actual performance based on the cost basis.

equitiesValue.description: Total USD portfolio value of all equities (sum(equity price * equity amount)). Does not include cash balance.

cryptocurrenciesValue.description: Total USD value of all cryptocurrencies in the portfolio.

nftsValue.description: Total USD value of all NFTs in the portfolio.

costBasis.description: The total original value (or purchase price) of the asset
The total original value (or purchase price) of the asset

marketValue.description: Market value of the asset: amount of asset multiplied by last asset value.

portfolioPercentage.description: What percentage of total portfolio value is taken by this asset.

totalReturn.description:
Total return of investment of this asset. Can be negative or null. Based on the cost basis of the asset, cost basis
is not available by some of integrations.

returnPercentage.description: Percent of return of investment for this asset. Can be negative or null.

lastPrice.description: Current last price of the asset.

companyName.description: Company name of the relative asset/

totalDailyReturn.description: Total daily return of investment for this asset. Can be negative.

dailyReturnPercentage.description: Daily percent of return of investment for this asset. Can be negative.

financialScore.description:
Front analyzes available financial data to reach a determination on risk associated with an asset based on its underlying financial conditions.
The Financials Score is a strong metric for investors who seek stocks that are underperforming and ripe for growth.

performanceScore.description:
Front's proprietary algorithm performs advanced statistical analysis.
We use tools popular among hedge funds to assess historical performance based on different categories and volatility of assets over a short period of time.

newsScore.description:
Front Market Monitor autonomously crawls tens of thousands of websites
at a time and assigns each stock a score based on the news stories

esgScore.description:
Environmental, Social, Governance
Parameters are a set of standards used to evaluate investments.
Environmental criteria consider how a company performs as a proponent of nature.
Social criteria examine how it manages relationships with employees, suppliers, customers,
and the communities where it operates. Governance deals with a companys leadership, audits, and shareholder rights.

id.description: The identifier of the news item.

imageUrl.description: The url of the image related to th news.

source.description: The name of the news source.

sourceUrl.description: The url of the news source.

createdTimestamp.description: The time of the creation of the news.

url.description: The url where the news is available.

rank.description: Integer value which describes the relevance of the news in the Front system.

symbols.description: List of stock symbols mentioned in the news.

cryptocurrencySymbols.description: List of cryptocurrencies mentioned in the news.

count.description: The total count of news related to the symbol

fund.description:
Buying power of the account. Typically consists of cash plus available margin.
For non-margin accounts fund contains cash only

isReconnected.description:
Indicates if this account was already connected by the current user and device.
Can be null.

balances.description: The list of all asset balances of account

authenticationSchemeType.description: Type of authentication for the integration.

initialAuthenticationModel.description: Set of fields that should be provided in the initial POST `authenticate` request.

authenticationSteps.description: Set of fields that should be provided depending on the status of the response of the first POST `authenticate` request.

mfaSchemes.description: Supported MFA schemes, can be none or multiple.

instructionsUrl.description: Optional URL with the instructions explaining how to create a set of API key/secret for the integration, can be shown to the end user.

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

data.description: Additional data to send on-chain (optional, depends on an integration)

targetAddress.description: Target address to transfer the asset to

fee.description: On-chain fee (optional, depends on an integration)

addressType.description:
Type of the address of symbol to be transferred. Providing `EthAddress` will initiate a transfer of ETH over Ethereum blockchain.
Can be used instead of `Symbol` and `Chain` fields.
To transfer assets over non-default chains (e.g. sending USDT over ERC20) please `Symbol` and `Chain` fields.

mfaCode.description: 2 Factor auth code (optional, depends on an integration)

password.description: Password or pass-phrase, required to send transfers (optional, depends on an integration)

chain.description:
Custom chain name, required by some of the integrations. E.g. USDT can be sent over USDT-ERC20, USDT-TRC20, and USDT-Omni.
Can be used to transfer assets over non-default chains (e.g. sending USDT over ERC20).
Please use `symbol/details` endpoint to get the list of all possible chains.

symbol.description: Symbol to be transferred. Can be provided instead of the `AddressType` field.

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

symbol.description:
Symbol of the required cryptocurrency, e.g. ETH or BTC.
Can be used instead of the `AddressType` field.

addressType.description:
Type of the address of symbol to be transferred. Providing `EthAddress` will assume a transfer of ETH over Ethereum blockchain.
Can be used instead of `Symbol` field.

chain.description: Chain of the required cryptocurrency, e.g. USDT has USDT-ERC20, USDT-TRC20, and USDT-Omni

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

addressType.description: Type of the address of the transferred asset. Can be used instead of the `Symbol` field.

transactionId.description: Transaction Id by the financial institution

transactionHash.description: Hash of the transaction on the blockchain

symbol.description: Symbol of the transferred asset. Can be provided instead of the `AddressType` field.

buyingPower.description:
BuyingPower indicates total amount of money the user can spend for buying stock. Always includes cash and
can also include margin

cryptoBuyingPower.description: BuyingPower indicates total amount of money the user can spend for buying crypto.

cash.description: Account cash indicates total amount of money

createNewRefreshToken.description:
Optional, used when we the refresh token should be refreshed.
Currently this flow is supported by TD Ameritrade

accessToken.description:
Some institutions may require accessToken to be provided as well.
It's currently required by WeBull only

tradeToken.description: Currently used to update WeBull trade token.

authToken.description: Auth token that allows connecting to the target institution

type.description: Type of the institution to connect

count.description:
Number of records to include in the response.
Default: `100`
Maximum: `250`

cursor.description:
The cursor to retrieve the next page of transactions.
Providing it will cause the response to only return changes after this update.
If this field is not provided, the history of transactions will be returned starting with the first-added transaction.

statuses.description: If this value is provided, result set is filtered to only include transaction with the provided statuses.

cryptocurrencyAddressType.description: For cryptocurrency address the type of address is required.

url.description: Url to open Front catalog that should be presented to the end user.

iFrameUrl.description: Url to open Front catalog in iFrame that should be presented to the end user.

marketValue.description: Amount of NFTs multiplied by NFT value

portfolioPercentage.description: What percentage of total portfolio value is taken by this NFT

API-keys.description: Contact Front to get client Id and client Secret
API-keys.name: X-Client-Id and X-Client-Secret headers

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description:
### Supported integrations:
```Robinhood```
```ETrade```
```Alpaca```
```TdAmeritrade```
```WeBull```
```Stash```
```InteractiveBrokers```
```Public```
```Coinbase```
```Kraken```
```CoinbasePro```
```CryptoCom```
```Binance```
```Gemini```
```OkCoin```
```Bittrex```
```KuCoin```
```Etoro```
```CexIo```
```GateIo```
```Okx```
```BitFlyer```
```Coinlist```
```Huobi```
```Bitfinex```


### Integration-specific notes:


#### TdAmeritrade:


Because of limitations of TD Ameritrade API, it is not guaranteed that details of a new order

will be returned upon executing it.


#### Binance:


Because of limitations of Binance API, initial loading of transaction history in Binance can take long time

depending on the size of the portfolio.


#### OkCoin:


Getting transactions history from OkCoin is not currently supported.

tags.name: Transfers
tags.description:
### Supported integrations:
```Robinhood```
```Coinbase```
```Kraken```
```CoinbasePro```
```CryptoCom```
```Binance```
```Gemini```
```CryptocurrencyAddress```
```CryptocurrencyWallet```
```OkCoin```
```Bittrex```
```KuCoin```
```BinanceInternational```
```GateIo```
```Okx```
```Huobi```
```Bitfinex```


### Integration-specific notes:


#### Robinhood:


Cryptocurrency transfers should be enabled in Robinhood settings. Transfers are disabled by default, enabling them for end users requires a review from Robinhood.

Please note:
 * `MfaCode` parameter is required to initiate a transaction in Robinhood.
 * The user's security settings should be configured to use an authenticator application.
 * Robinhood doesn't allow initiation of transactions if the authenticator application is not configured.


#### Coinbase:


`MfaCode` parameter should be used to initiate transactions in Coinbase.
 * If the end user's Coinbase account is configured to use text messages (SMS) for two factor authentication, the API will return `MfaRequired` status, and a text code will then be sent by Coinbase. The code is expected to be provided in the subsequent call using the `MfaCode` request field
 * If the account is configured to use an authenticator application, the API is expecting to get the code in the `MfaCode` request field.


#### Kraken:


Kraken requires the explicit chain name to be provided (e.g. `Dogecoin` or `Ethereum (ERC20)`). The list of possible chains can be obtained by calling `symbol/details` endpoint.

To initiate a transaction, a Kraken Address Key name should be provided in `TargetAddress` field. Target address should be added using Kraken UI, then its name should be used.


#### CoinbasePro:
 * CoinbasePro does not provide multiple chains per a symbol, so default chains are used for getting Deposit addresses.


#### Binance:


`Enable Withdrawals` permission should be given to the user's API key to initiate transfers with Binance Us.

Binance requires adding the IP address to the list of trusted IPs to be able to create API keys with transfer permission.
 * Please reach out to Front to get the static IP address. This address should be provided to the end user, and the user should be instructed to add it to the list of trusted IP addresses.
 * By default, the permission to enable withdrawals is turned off. If the end user's API key does not have the permission, asset transfers will not be available.


#### KuCoin:


KuCoin requires adding the IP address to the list of trusted IPs to be able to create API keys with transfer permission.

`Fee` parameter should be used to initiate a transaction in KuCoin.

Please note:
 * Please reach out to Front to get the static IP address. This address should be provided to the end user, and the user should be instructed to add it to the list of trusted IP addresses.
 * All currencies have their minimum `fee` and `amount` requirements. Please use `symbol/details` endpoint to get this data for a particular symbol.
 * KuCoin requires chain name to be provided for getting deposit address or initiating a cryptocurrency transfer. Some cryptocurrencies are supported over multiple chains. It's recommended to use `symbol/details` endpoint to get the list of supported chains and show it to the end user to select a target one.


#### BinanceInternational:


`Enable Withdrawals` permission should be given to the user's API key to initiate transfers with Binance International.

Binance requires adding the IP address to the list of trusted IPs to be able to create API keys with transfer permission.
 * Please reach out to Front to get the static IP address. This address should be provided to the end user, and the user should be instructed to add it to the list of trusted IP addresses.
 * By default, the permission to enable withdrawals is turned off. If the end user's API key does not have the permission, asset transfers will not be available.


#### GateIo:


Gate.io requires adding IP address to the list of trusted IP addresses to be able to initiate a cryptocurrency transfers.

Withdrawal address should be already verified or added on the Gate.io UI (in mobile application or on the web site).
 * Please reach out to Front to get the static IP address for withdrawals. This address should be provided to the end user, and the user should be instructed to add it to the list of trusted IP addresses.
 * Only verified withdrawal blockchain addresses are allowed for withdrawal with Gate.io API.
 * Gate.io requires chain name to be provided for getting deposit address or initiating a cryptocurrency transfer. Some cryptocurrencies are supported over multiple chains. It's recommended to use `symbol/details` endpoint to get the list of supported chains and show it to the end user to select a target one.


#### Huobi:


Warning: Huobi does not refund executed deposits that are below the `Minimum Deposit Amount`
 * Please check the MinimumDepositAmount in Get Deposit Address response in order to avoid making a deposit below the minimum amount
 * Huobi does not allow withdrawals to addresses that are not white-listed, please add the address that you would like to withdraw to the white list of addresses through the UI so that a withrawal can be processed


#### Bitfinex:
 * The hash of transfer is not available when making a transfer in Bitfinex. To get the hash please re-query the transfer using the transaction id.
 * Bitfinex does not separate sub-accounts when returning the list of transfers.Therefore the same list of transfers is returned for all Bitfinex sub-accounts.
